intro: Johnstonella mexicana, commonly known as the Mexican Johnstonella, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its slender, aromatic stems and small white or greenish flowers. It typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Johnstonella mexicana is often found in open areas with well-drained soil, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
